Path::contents/AIC Internal Troubleshoot: Injury and Illness Module overview for robohelp

Injury and Illness Module
  Injury and Illness Module Overviewand Illness Module Overview
  
  The Injury/Illness Module is one of the most commonly used Modules. It serves as the basis of our Incident Management suite. Within this Module you are able to report on the incident records you have created, populate OSHA Logs, and submit claims to your TPA’s.
   
  In this Module you will enter of the information that you have gathered regarding an injury/illness incident. As you will see all of the modules and module items have a common user interface. When adding or editing a record there will be a series of tabs across the top of the incident form that will contain required data fields to save or maintain the record and a series of tabs across the bottom of the incident form for collecting additional information or attachments.
   
  Injury and Illness Module Item:
  Within the Injury/Illness Module Item you will see a dynamic search and display grid showing all previously entered incidents in the Injury and Illness module. What is unique about our search grid is by selecting the heading at the top of each column you can sort the records alphabetically or by date in the column selected. You can also search for a specific record using multiple columns to narrow down your search. Our system also supports wild card searches by putting a % symbol in front of and behind the partial word you have entered (ex: %Diego%).
  
   
  
  Adding an Incident Record:
  When adding a new record follow the steps below:
  
    Select the Add button, the Incident Type and Location Form will populate
    All required fields (marked with a red asterisk) must be complete before you can move onto the next step.
    Select the Type of report which is automatically populated in the dropdown.
    Next you can narrow down your location search by opening up your organizational structure. Once you find the group or level you are looking for click on it. All the locations available will automatically populate in the Select Incident Location drop down. Select the location for this record.
    The Final step is to select an employee for whom the record is being created for. The employees that automatically populate here are those who are assigned this location as their work location in the People Module item within the Administration Module. You will search for the employee by last name or employee number. In the search criteria field insert a letter or part of a name, all the employees that match the search criteria for that location will automatically populate in the employee dropdown.
  
  
    
    If you cannot find the employee you are looking for you are able to create a people record on the fly by clicking the Add New Employee Button. The employee details input form will populate for you to fill in the required information. Click save and close to return to the Incident Type and Location Form.
      
        Once the employee is selected or created click ok to move onto the Incident Form.
      
    
  
  General Details Main Tab:
  
  This tab is used to capture the general information regarding this incident on a broad spectrum. All of the required data fields have a red asterisk next to their title.
  
  
    The work location is auto populated based upon the work location that was selected on the Incident Type and Location form.
    If the employee related to this record is a traveling employee, you can select the edit button to change the incident location.
    There is a field for capturing a claim number from your Worker’s Comp TPA. This can be manually entered or populated by an automated data feed from your TPA.
    The case status is a pick list used for describing this particular case’s status.
    The Major Event pick list is an optional data field. To populate this drop down a major event incident must be added to the Major Event Incidents Module Item within the Administration Module. This dropdown is used for capturing general incident information and allocating it across multiple modules to associate common dates, times, location and general details of a major event. Example: There is a fire on the manufacturing floor, which causes a spill, which results in a slip/ trip/ fall injury of and employee. These are 3 separate incidents, but 1 major event.
    There are additional pick lists for Location Code and Claim Type.
    Next we have the Incident Level pick list that is client defined, as are all pick list values throughout the application. The “what’s this” button can be selected to display your incident severity levels and their corresponding descriptions. To change the description of this pick list or the levels contact AIC Support.
    Severity Consequence Matrix
    Date of Incident, Incident Time, Date Reported to Employer, and Time Reported to Employer can be selected by clicking on the time or date field, you will see a calendar control or time drop down for accuracy purposes. Just click the date you would like to choose and it will auto populate the field.
    There is additional fields to tie this incident to a Work Shift, or a Part of Shift. The work shift field is populated in the Work Shift Module Item within the
      Administration Module.
    
    All of the required Preparer fields are auto populated by the system based on the username and login of the person creating this incident record. That person’s credentials will remain with the incident even if it is edited later by someone else.
    The final pick list on this tab is the Work Station/ Area validation table. This list is also made up of client defined values. To the right is a text box for associating the work station/ area to a specific location the incident took place.
    The final required field is the Give a Brief Description of the Incident text box that allows for additional information related to the incident. (100 Character Max.)
    There is a separate text box for documenting the Employee/ Contractor statement. (1000 Character Max.)
  
   
  The information reported in this tab will flow to the OSHA 301, 300 Log and 300A Summary and BLS 9300 in their exact formats when generating reports.
  Employee Details Main Tab:
  The employee Details main tab integrates with the people records created in the Administration Module to populate all of the Employee details. The display of this information is profile driven, which allows these fields to be hidden from view based upon the end users security level.
  
    
      
        If the Employee Details are not for the correct employee you can click the Search for New Employee button to search for a different employee.
        The Employee Details are automatically populated for First Name, Last name, Middle initial, Employee number, SSN, date of hire, Job title, Department, and supervisor based on the person selected on the Incident Type and Location Form.
        There are two required fields on this tab. The first is the Drug Test Given. The radio button defaults to NO, so the requirements are fulfilled automatically. If the Yes radio button is selected for Drug Test you will be required to select the appropriate test given from the Test Given pick list. This pick list is populated from the Drug Test Module Item within the Incident Reporting Module. The date and time of the test will also need to be filled in.
        The second required field is the Alcohol Test Given. The radio button is also defaulted to NO, so the requirements are fulfilled automatically. If Yes is selected for Alcohol Test you will be required to record the date and time of the test.
        Work Details that are captured in this tab include the time that the employee began work, the date that they started their current position, the task that was being performed, the EE’s experience with that task, how often the EE performs the task, the part/model number that they were working with at the time of the incident, and any relevant EE Hobbies. None of these items are required however they provide extra information for those who want it.
      
    
  
  The information reported in this tab will flow to the OSHA 301, 300 Log and 300A Summary and BLS 9300 in their exact formats when generating reports.
  What- How Main Tab:
  The What- How main tab collects the information on what happened and treatment information for the employee.
  
  
    The basic Treatment Information is collected using a series of radio buttons. The only one required is: Was medical treatment provided on site. If No is selected the fulfillments are met. If Yes is selected 2 additional required text boxes appear, the treatment provided and the provided by text boxes.
    The Hospital/Treatment Facility pick list is for choosing where the employee went for treatment. This drop down is populated in the Hospitals Module Item within the Incident Reporting Module. The Physician/Health Care Professional pick list is for choosing the person who attended to the employee. This drop down is populated in the Physicians Module Item within the Incident Reporting Module. The system is set up to only populate the Hospital/Treatment Facilities and Physician/Health Care Professionals that are associated with the location associated with that record.
    The 4 text boxes under the Describe in Detail What Happened section allow you to record information that will flow directly to the OSHA 301 and First Report of injury.
    The Object/Substance pick list refers to what was involved in injuring the employee. This pick list is populated by the
      Object/Substance Module Item within the Administration Module.
    
    The Accident Type pick list refers to the type of accident the employee endured. This pick list is populated by the Injury Event Module Item within the Administration Module.
    The Agency/ Source of Injury pick list refers to reason for the incident. This pick list is populated by the Injury Source Module Item within the Administration Module.
    The Specify the primary body part for reporting purposes is made up of 3 pick lists which are used to record what body part on the employee where the incident took place. The Body Part pick lists is populated in the Body Part Module Item within the Administration Module. The Nature of Injury pick list is populated within the Nature of Injury Module Item within the Administration Module.
    The Add button is used if an employee was injured on more than one body part. When added the additional body parts that were injured would be included to this incident record for precision in your reporting.
  
   
  The information reported in this tab will flow to the OSHA 301, 300 Log and 300A Summary and BLS 9300 in their exact formats when generating reports.
  Recordability Main Tab:
  The recordability main tab allows you the flexibility to easily record both recordable and non-recordable incident information by selecting the appropriate radio button.
  In the Non Recordable section, if Frist Aid is selected, a pick list will populate allowing you to select the appropriate form of first aid that was administered. The 14 forms of first aid are provided by OSHA.
  In the Recordable Incidents section, you can select if this incident is an:
  
    Injury
    Illness
    Privacy case
    Sharp/ Needle stick
    Fatality
    Override OSHA Recordability
    Loss of Consciousness
    If any other treatment other than first aid (that is recordable)
    If you are aware of any issues that make you question if this injury is work related and
    If there was a pre- existing condition.
  
   
  The logic set up in our system is based upon whether you selected this case to be recordable or non- recordable when creating this incident record. If the record was chosen to be set up as an injury in the Incident Type and Location Form and then was changed to a non-recordable in the recordability main tab, the system will stop you and prompt you with a message that states: “By changing this case to Non Recordable, any Days Away or Restricted Duty days away will be lost. Do you wish to continue?”
   
  The information reported in this tab will flow to the OSHA 301, 300 Log and 300A Summary and BLS 9300 in their exact formats when generating reports.
  Root Cause Main Tab:
  
  The Root Cause main tab is the first of 2 investigative tabs for this incident. The Root Cause Main tab allows you to declare your problem statement by establishing your 5 Why tree. We have actually taken this out to 10 Why for your investigation. These are all free form text boxes.
  5 Why Main Tab:
  The 5 Why Main Tab is a new tab that allows you to declare your problem statement, while using a pick list to categorize each of you why statements. The 5 Why pick list is populated from the 5 Why Category Module Item within the Administration Module.
  
  There is no limit to the amount of “Why” paths that you can add for this incident case. Simply click the Add Why Path to create a new path.
  Causal Factors Main Tab:
  The Causal Factors Main tab is the second investigative tab which allows you to use a series of text boxes and pick lists to assist in the investigation of the Immediate and underlying causes of this incident.
   
  Here we can identify the following:
  
    
      
        The immediate cause of the accident with a free form text box.
        The Unsafe Conditions pick list is populated by the Unsafe Conditions Module Item within the Administration Module.
        The Unsafe Acts pick list is populated by the Unsafe Acts Module Item within the Administration Module.
        The underlying cause of the accident with a free form text box.
        The Job Factors pick list is populated by the Job Factors Module Item within the Administration Module.
        The Personal Factors pick list is populated by the Personal Factors Module Item within the Administration Module.
        The failure in the safety management system pick list is populated by the Failure in System Module Item within the Administration Module
        If the job is covered by a JSA/ work instruction with a radio button.
      
    
  
  ‎‎Wage Insurance Disability Main Tab
  The wage Insurance Disability Main tab is the first of 2 tabs that display the Workers Compensation capabilities of the system.
  The employee wage information can be pulled from the client HRIS system and populated into the Employee Wage Information section.
   
  In the employee disability information section the point and click calendar controls make it simple to record the Day last Worked and the Day that Disability Began. There are radio buttons to acknowledge if the employee was paid in full for the day of the injury.
   
  The final section of this tab contains the Insurance and Coverage Information. Here we can identify, using localized pick lists:
  
    
      
        
          
            The Carrier pick list is populated by the Carriers Module Item within the Incident Reporting Module.
            The Agent pick list is populated by the Agent Module Item within the Incident Reporting Module.
            The Administrator pick list is populated by the Claims Administrators Module Item within the Incident Reporting Module.
            The Adjuster pick list is populated by the Claims Adjuster Module Item within the Incident Reporting Module.
          
        
      
    
  
  The (State) FROI Main Tab:
  The First Report of Injury (FROI) main tab is dynamically created by our application and appears for the state based upon the location that was selected when creating the incident record. Each State has different requirements creating each FROI to be slightly different.
  
  What Happens, Review Approval Process, and Cost/Hours Mini Tab
   
  What Happened Mini Tab:
  This is a text field used to give a description of the incident in greater detail due to the larger amount of text than allowed in “Give a Brief Description” text box.
  Review Approval Process Mini Tab:
  This is where you can set up a review/ approval process, using a series of email alerts and reminders, for an incident to go through the different levels of review necessary with an automated process. The review process is set up in the Administration Module within the Review Process Module Item.
  Cost/Hours Mini Tab:
  This tab provides the user the ability to view any cost information associated with this incident. The cost information can be pulled back from the TPA and populated here automatically, or can be entered manually based on the users profile level. Additionally, the reserve for this incident can be assigned and tracked within this mini tab.
  Files, People Involved, and Corrective Actions Mini Tab
  Files Mini Tab: This is where supporting documentation regarding this incident can be attached. Attachments can include pictures, videos, scanned documents, pdf’s and more. By selecting the “View Valid File Types” button, you can see all file formats that are supported in this tab.
  People Involved Mini Tab:
  This is where information from a witnesses, first responders, or any other person/people that may be associated with the incident can be captured. Record who they are, how to get a hold of them, and their statement.
  Corrective Actions Mini Tab: Anywhere in the system you can assign a corrective action that are enforced through a series of automated emails and alerts. The controls that govern the coming due, escalation and past due emails and alerts are client defined within the Alerts Module and Alerts Module Item. Once you have completed your initial set up, they will fire off automatically as applicable. All corrective actions can be updated directly from an email, you do not have to log into the system to update the statuses.
  
    ‎‎Communications Mini Tab
  In addition to automated email alerts you can broadcast an incident report to a group of people via an email, directly from this tab. Select the person or group of people you would like to receive the email and attach files from the “Files” mini tab using point and click check boxes.
  To set up the names or groups who can receive these emails are done in the Administration Module within the Communications Module Item. The communications is set up based on location. Once a location is selected the list of recipients can be created by individuals which can then create groups. To upload individuals there is an Upload Wizard button which gives you step by step directions to load more than one person at a time.
  
  Updates, Days Away/Restricted, and History Mini Tab
  Updates Mini Tab:
  Is an electronic diary that records any date/time stamps and any updates recorded in this tab.
  Days Away/Restricted Mini Tab: This tab is calendar controlled and can start and stop counting the days away/restricted as many times as you need. It will count up to/capping at 180 days per OSHA, giving proper weight to days away vs. restricted. For a WC case it will keep counting days until the case is closed.
  History Mini Tab:
  This feature will show you any/all other incidents the employee has been involved in with your organization since the start of their employment. You can view the historical incident details by selecting the incident record in the display grid and select the “View” button.
  Edit - To edit an incident record follow the steps below:
  
    
      
        
          
            Highlight desired incident record with one click
            Select the Edit button at the top
            Edit the incident record as needed
            Select Save and Close
               
              Delete – To remove an incident record, we usually leave all records for historical purposes even if they are no longer needed at this point in time, follow the steps below:
            
            Highlight desired incident record with one click
            Select the Delete button at the top
            Select the Delete button within the popup
               
              Print – To print an incident record follow the steps below:
            
            Highlight desired incident record with one click
            Select the Print button at the top
            A PDF version of the incident record will be created
            Select print to print the record
               
              View – This will open up the incident record so you can view the details without editing them:
            
            Select desired incident record
            Click the View button
            The record will open allowing you to view the details
               
              Send to Excel – This will take all the incident records shown in the search grid and transport it to an excel sheet. It will only include the details seen in the search grid not the details shown on any other forms. If there is more than one page you will have to send to excel for each page. It only sends the page you are currently on to excel:
            
            Click Send To Excel Button
            The incident records will be transported and open via Excel
               
              Search – is used to find a variable quickly without having to look through all the variables.
            
            Type your search value in any of the blank spaces within the header boxes (ex: ORGANIZATION, LOCATION, CASE NUMBER, CASE STATUS, INCIDENT TYPE, INCIDENT LEVEL, FIRST NAME, LAST NAME, INJURY DATE, SUBMITED TO TPA, DEPARTMENT)
            Click Search
            The list will refresh and display items that match your search characters
            For a wildcard search simply enclose your search value within %’s (ex: %San Diego%) again the list will refresh and display items that match your search characters
          
        
      
    
  
   
  Injury and Illness Module – Injury and Illness Incidents Module Item
  301 Report and Sent Status
  301 Report:
  Allows Users to generate a 301 report for any incident record in the Incidents Module Item. Highlight the record desired and click the 301 Report button. The Report will generate into a PDF.
  Sent Status:
  Allows Users to view if an incident record has been submitted to their TPA. Highlight the Record and click the Sent Status button. A record can be submitted only once. If the record has not been submitted it can be submitted using the Submit to TPA button.
  If the record has been submitted to the TPA it will show the date and time it was submitted. If the record needs to be resubmitted for some reason, there is a check box which is profile controlled and allows for a record to be resubmitted. The user can then resubmit the record.
   
  Injury and Illness Module – Injury and Illness Incidents Module Item
  Print Short Report and Print WSIB Form 7
  Print Short Report:
  Allows Users to generate a short version of the incident report for any incident record in the Incidents Module Item. Highlight the record desired and click the Print Short Report button. The Report will generate into a PDF.
  Print WSIB Form 7:
  Allows Users to generate a WSIB Form 7 for any incident report located within the Canadian Province of Ontario in the Incidents Module Item. Highlight the record desired and click the Print WSIB Form 7 button. The Report will generate into a PDF.
   
  Injury and Illness Module – Injury and Illness Incidents Module Item
  Submit to TPA
  Submit to TPA:
  Allows Users to submit incident records directly to a TPA. Highlight the desired incident record. Click the Submit to TPA button. The claim submission form will populate. If you want to submit the claim click the Submit this Claim button.
  A confirmation that the claim was submitted will appear. You can print this for your records.
  Sharps Injury Log
  The OSHA Log/Summary Module Item allows Users with access to generate the Sharps Injury Log, 300 Log, and Privacy Case reports.
  Sharps Injury Log:
  Allows Users to generate a Sharps Injury Log report for any location in the OSHA Log/Summary Module Item. Highlight the location desired and click the Sharps Injury Log button. The Select Sharps Log Year screen will populate. Select the year and click ok. The Report will generate into a PDF.
  300 Log:
  Allows Users to generate a 300 Log report for any of the locations in the OSHA Log/Summary Module Item. Highlight the location desired and click the 300 Log button. The Select OSHA Log Year screen will populate. Select the year and either the case number or injury date, then click ok. The Report will generate into a PDF.
  Print 300 A Summary
  Print 300 A Summary:
  Allows Users to generate a 300 A Summary report for any of the locations in the OSHA Log/Summary Module Item. Highlight the location desired and click the 300 A Summary button. The Select 300 A Summary screen will populate. Select the year and if you are going to manually input annual average number of employees and total hours worked by all employees last year, then click ok. The Report will generate into a PDF.
  Privacy Case and Other Buttons
  Privacy Case:
  Allows Users to generate a Privacy Case report for any location in the OSHA Log/Summary Module Item. Highlight the location desired and click the Privacy Case button. The Select Privacy Case Year screen will populate. Select the year and click ok. The Report will generate into a PDF.
  Other Buttons:
  Send to Excel – This will take all the locations shown in the search grid and transport it to an excel sheet. It will only include the details seen in the search grid not the details shown on any other forms.
  
    Click Send To Excel Button
    The locations will be transported and open via Excel
      Search – is used to find a variable quickly without having to look through all the variables.
    
    Type your search value in any of the blank spaces within the header boxes (ex: ORGANIZATION, NAME, ADDRESS 1, CITY, STATE/PROV, POSTAL/ZIP CODE, COUNTRY)
    Click Search
    The list will refresh and display items that match your search characters
    For a wildcard search simply enclose your search value within %’s (ex: %San Diego%) again the list will refresh and display items that match your search characters

  Monthly Employee Hours
  The Employee Hours Module Item allows Users to track Monthly Employee Hours, Daily Employee Hours, and/or Monthly Non-Employee Hours by location. The logic set up in our system for this functionality does not allow for data to be recorded for time that has not happened yet. As the next month starts the availability to record data becomes available.
  Monthly Employee Hours:
  Allows Users to add/edit the number of hours worked by hourly employees, temporary employees, and salary employees. To update or change the hours for a location, highlight the location desired and click the Monthly Employee Hours Button. The Employee Hours Input Form will populate. Fill in the number of hours worked by hourly, temporary, and salary employees. The total number of hours worked between the 3 categories are automatically calculated under the total hours column. The last column is for the number of total employees that worked for that month. Click save and close when done.
  Daily Employee Hours:
  Allows Users to add/edit the number of hours worked by hourly employees, temporary employees, and salary employees. To update or change the hours for a location, highlight the location desired and click the Daily Employee Hours Button. The Daily Hours Input Form will populate. Fill in the number of hours worked by hourly, temporary, and salary employees. The total number of hours worked between the 3 categories are automatically calculated under the total hours column. The last column is for the number of total employees that worked for that month. Click save and close when done.
  Monthly Non-Employee Hours:
  Allows Users to add/edit the number of hours worked by contractors and non-employees. To update or change the hours for a location, highlight the location desired and click the Monthly Non-Employee Hours Button. The Non-Employee Hours Input Form will populate. Fill in the number of hours worked by contractors and non-employees. The total number of hours worked between the 2 categories are automatically calculated under the total hours column. Click save and close when done.

It only sends the page you are currently on to excel:

        The list will refresh and display items that match your search characters

  Within the International Short Form Module Item you will see a dynamic search and display grid showing all previously entered incidents in the this module. The International Short Form was created as a quicker way to create incident records. It captures less information than the Incidents Module Item but it still flows to the OSHA Log.
  When adding a new record follow the steps below:
  
    Select the Add button, the Injury Short Form Input Screen will populate
    All required fields (marked with an asterisk) must be complete before you can save and close the record.
  
  
    Select the Date of Incident by using the calendar control. Click the date you would like to choose and it will auto populate the field.
    Select the Location of the incident by clicking the dropdown. All the locations within the Locations Module Item in the
      Administration Module automatically populate into the drop down.
    
    Select the Report Type by clicking the dropdown.
    Type in the Employees First Name and Last Name.
    Select the Employees Job Title. All the job titles within the Job Titles Module Item in the Administration Module
      automatically populate into the drop down.
    
    Select the Body Part that was injured. All the body parts within the Body Part Module Item in the Administration Module automatically populate into the drop down.
    Select the Injury Type. All the injury types within the Nature of Injury Module Item in the Administration Module
      automatically populate into the drop down.
    
    Type in where on the premises the incident occurred.
    This is where supporting documentation regarding this incident can be attached. Attachments can include pictures, videos, scanned documents, pdf’s and more.
  
  Edit - To edit an incident record follow the steps below:
  
    Highlight desired incident record with one click
    Select the Edit button at the top
    Edit the incident record as needed
    Select Save and Close
      Delete Injury – To remove an incident record, we usually leave all records for historical purposes even if they are no longer needed at this point in time, follow the steps below:
    
    Highlight desired incident record with one click
    Select the Delete button at the top
    Select the Delete button within the popup

It will only include the details seen in the search grid not the details shown on any other parts of the form. If there is more than one page you will have to send to excel for each page. It only sends the page you are currently on to excel:
    
    Click Send To Excel Button
    The incident records will be transported and open via Excel
      Search – is used to find a variable quickly without having to look through all the variables.
    
    Type your search value in any of the blank spaces within the header boxes (ex: LOCATION, FIRST NAME, LAST NAME, PRIMARY CASE NUMBER, INJURY DATE, MAJOR EVENT NUMBER)
    Click Search
    The list will refresh and display items that match your search characters
    For a wildcard search simply enclose your search value within %’s (ex: %San Diego%) again the list will refresh and display items that match your search characters
  
  Within the Short Form Module Item you will see a search and display grid showing all previously entered incidents in the module. The Short form is very similar to the Incidents Module Item but is shorter and is quicker for creating incident records. It does not hold as much detail and but it still flows to the OSHA Log.
  Adding a Short Form Record
  
    
      
        When adding a new record follow the steps below:
        Select the Add button, the Incident Type and Location Form will populate
        All required fields (marked with a red asterisk) must be complete before you can move onto the next step.
        Select the Type of report which is automatically populated in the dropdown.
        Next you can narrow down your location search by opening up your organizational structure. Once you find the group or level you are looking for click on it. All the locations available will automatically populate in the Select Incident Location drop down. Select the location for this record.
      
    
  
  
    The Location Code can be selected by picking from the drop down.
    The Work Shift can also be selected by picking from the drop down. The work shift field is populated in the Work Shift Module Item within the Administration Module
    Date of Incident, Incident Time, Date Reported to Employer, and Time Reported to Employer can be selected by clicking on the time or date field, you will see a calendar control or time drop down for accuracy purposes. Just click the date you would like to choose and it will auto populate the field.
    Select an Employee for whom the record is being created for. The employees that automatically populate here are those who are assigned this location as their work location in the People Module item within the Administration Module. You will search for the employee by last name or employee number. In the search criteria field insert a letter or part of a name, all the employees that match the search criteria for that location will automatically populate in the employee dropdown.
    Select the Supervisor of the employee. The supervisors that are assigned to this location will automatically populate into this drop down. Once selected, if their information is already in the system, their information will automatically populate the supervisor phone field and the supervisor email field.
    The Give a Brief Description of the Incident text box that allows for a description of the incident. (100 Character Max.)
    If Illness was selected for Report Type a second field appears with a drop down for the Illness Type.
    The Body Part is used to record what body part was affected on the employee by the incident that took place. The Body Part pick lists is populated in the Body Part Module Item within the Administration Module.
    The Nature of Injury pick list is populated within the Nature of Injury Module Item within the Administration Module.
    The Treatment Provided text box is for a description of the treatment the employee received.
    The Where the Event Occurred text box is for a description of where on the premises the incident took place.
    There is a set of radio buttons to answer if the Employee was sent Off Site for Treatment.
    The Hospital/Treatment Facility pick list is for choosing where the employee went for treatment. This drop down is populated in the Hospitals Module Item within the Incident Reporting Module. The system is set up to only populate the Hospital/Treatment Facilities that are associated with the location associated with that record.
      Edit - To edit a short form record follow the steps below:
      
        Highlight desired incident record with one click
        Select the Edit button at the top
        Edit the incident record as needed
        Select Save and Close

        Select the Delete button at the top
        Select the Delete button within the popup

It will only include the details seen in the search grid not the details shown on any other forms. If there is more than one page you will have to send to excel for each page. It only sends the page you are currently on to excel:
        
        Click Send To Excel Button
        The incident records will be transported and open via Excel
          Search – is used to find a variable quickly without having to look through all the variables.
        
        Type your search value in any of the blank spaces within the header boxes (ex: ORGANIZATION, LOCATION, CASE NUMBER, CASE STATUS, INCIDENT TYPE, INCIDENT LEVEL, FIRST NAME, LAST NAME, INJURY DATE, SUBMITED TO TPA, DEPARTMENT)
        Click Search
        The list will refresh and display items that match your search characters
        For a wildcard search simply enclose your search value within %’s (ex: %San Diego%) again the list will refresh and display items that match your search character

        Select Add button
        Fill in required field (red asterisk mark)
        Optional Fields: Drug Test Description, Assign to All Locations check box, Active check box
        Once finished click Save and Close
           
          Edit - To edit a Drug Test follow the steps below:
        
        Highlight the desired Drug Test with one click
        Select the Edit button at the top
        Edit the Drug Test as needed
        Select Save and Close
           
          Delete – To remove a Drug Test, we usually leave all Drug Tests for historical purposes even if they are no longer needed. Drug Tests can be made inactive which would leave the historical records but remove it from the drop down options for users to choose from. To delete follow the steps below:
        
        Highlight the desired Drug Test with one click
        Select the Delete button at the top
        Select the Delete button within the popup
           
          Send to Excel – This will take all the Drug Tests shown in the search grid and transport it to an excel sheet. It will only include the details seen in the search grid not the details shown on any other forms. If there is more than one page you will have to send to excel for each page. It only sends the page you are currently on to excel:
        
        Click Send To Excel Button
        The Drug Tests will be transported and open via Excel
      
    
  
  Search – is used to find a variable quickly without having to look through all the variables.
  
    
      
        Type your search value in any of the blank spaces within the header boxes (ex: DRUG TEST, DRUG TEST DESCRIPTION, ACTIVE)
        Click Search
        The list will refresh and display items that match your search characters
        For a wildcard search simply enclose your search value within %’s (ex: %Swab%) again the list will refresh and display items that match your search characters
           
          Assign Location - Allows Users to assign Locations to a specific Drug Test, the Drug Test will then automatically populate within records where the specified Location is selected.
        
        Select the desired Drug Test
        Select the Assign Location button
        Highlight all desired Available Locations
        Click the right arrow to move them to the Selected Locations field, click the left arrow to remove the location from the list
        Click Save and Close
           
          Location View - Displays the Available Drug Tests and the Drug Tests that have be assigned to each Location.
        
        Select the Location View button
        Select the Organization Level to search by
        Choose the Location desired
        The Available Drug Tests will populate in the left hand box and the Selected Drug Tests will populate in the Right hand box
        By simply selecting all the desired Drug Tests and clicking on either the right or left arrow they can then be assigned the Location chosen or unassigned from a location.
      
    
  
  The MSHA Incident Module Item is used for reporting incidents for companies with a mining department. Similar to OSHA, MSHA has their own specific safety standards for companies employing miners.
   
  Adding an Incident Record
   
  When adding a new record follow the steps below:
  
    
      
        Select the Add button, the Incident Type and Location Form will populate
        All required fields (marked with a red asterisk) must be complete before you can move onto the next step.
        Select the Type of report which is automatically populated in the dropdown.
        Next you can narrow down your location search by opening up your organizational structure. Once you find the group or level you are looking for click on it. All the locations available will automatically populate in the Select Incident Location drop down. Select the location for this record.
        The Final step is to select an employee for whom the record is being created for. The employees that automatically populate here are those who are assigned this location as their work location in the People Module item within the Administration Module. You will search for the employee by last name or employee number. In the search criteria field insert a letter or part of a name, all the employees that match the search criteria for that location will automatically populate in the employee dropdown.
           
           
        
        If you cannot find the employee you are looking for you are able to create a people record on the fly by clicking the Add New Employee Button. The employee details input form will populate for you to fill in the required information. Click save and close to return to the Incident Type and Location Form.
      
    
  
  General Details Main Tab:
  This tab is used to capture the general information regarding this incident on a broad spectrum. All of the required data fields have a red asterisk next to their title.
  
   
   
  
    The work location is auto populated based upon the work location that was selected on the Incident Type and Location form.
    If the employee related to this record is a traveling employee, you can select the edit button to change the incident location.
    There is a field for capturing a claim number from your Worker’s Comp TPA. This can be manually entered or populated by an automated data feed from your TPA.
    The case status is a pick list used for describing this particular case’s status.
    The Major Event pick list is an optional data field. To populate this drop down a major event incident must be added to the Major Event Incidents Module Item within the Administration Module. This dropdown is used for capturing general incident information and allocating it across multiple modules to associate common dates, times, location and general details of a major event. Example: There is a fire on the manufacturing floor, which causes a spill, which results in a slip/ trip/ fall injury of and employee. These are 3 separate incidents, but 1 major event.
    There are additional pick lists for Location Code and Claim Type.
    Next we have the Incident Level pick list that is client defined, as are all pick list values throughout the application. The “what’s this” button can be selected to display your incident severity levels and their corresponding descriptions. To change the description of this pick list or the levels contact AIC Support.
    Date of Incident, Incident Time, Date Reported to Employer, and Time Reported to Employer can be selected by clicking on the time or date field, you will see a calendar control or time drop down for accuracy purposes. Just click the date you would like to choose and it will auto populate the field.
    There is additional fields to tie this incident to a Work Shift, or a Part of Shift. The work shift field is populated in the Work Shift Module Item
      within the Administration Module.
    
    All of the required Preparer fields are auto populated by the system based on the username and login of the person creating this incident record. That person’s credentials will remain with the incident even if it is edited later by someone else.
    The final pick list on this tab is the Work Station/ Area validation table. This list is also made up of client defined values. To the right is a text box for associating the work station/ area to a specific location the incident took place.
    The final required field is the Give a Brief Description of the Incident text box that allows for additional information related to the incident. (100 Character Max.)
    There is a separate text box for documenting the Employee/ Contractor statement. (1000 Character Max.)
  
  Employee Details Main Tab:
  The Employee Details main tab integrates with the people records created in the Administration Module to populate all of the Employee details. The display of this information is profile driven, which allows these fields to be hidden from view based upon the end users security level.
  
    
      
        If the Employee Details are not for the correct employee you can click the Search for New Employee button to search for a different employee.
        The Employee Details are automatically populated for First Name, Last name, Middle initial, Employee number, SSN, date of hire, Job title, Department, and supervisor based on the person selected on the Incident Type and Location Form.
        Work Details that are captured in this tab include the time that the employee began work, the date that they started their current position, the task that was being performed, the EE’s experience with that task, how often the EE performs the task, the part/model number that they were working with at the time of the incident, and any relevant EE Hobbies. None of these items are required however they provide extra information for those who want it.
      
    
  
  What- How Main Tab:
  The What- How main tab collects the information on what happened and treatment information for the employee.
  .
  MSHA Details Main Tab:
  The MSHA main tab collects the information needed to file an MSHA Report. MSHA’s are for companies with a mining department. All mining incident would be recorded within this module item.
  
    The basic Treatment Information is collected using a series of radio buttons. The only one required is: Was medical treatment provided on site. If No is selected the fulfillments are met. If Yes is selected 2 additional required text boxes appear, the treatment provided and the provided by text boxes.
      
        The Add button is used if an employee was injured on more than one body part. When added the additional body parts that were injured would be included to this incident record for precision in your reporting.
        The Specify the primary body part for reporting purposes is made up of 3 pick lists which are used to record what body part on the employee where the incident took place. The Body Part pick lists is populated in the Body Part Module Item within the Administration Module. The Nature of Injury pick list is populated within the Nature of Injury Module Item within the Administration Module.
        The Agency/ Source of Injury pick list refers to reason for the incident. This pick list is populated by the Injury Source Module Item within the Administration Module.
        The Accident Type pick list refers to the type of accident the employee endured. This pick list is populated by the Injury Event Module Item within the Administration Module.
        The Object/Substance pick list refers to what was involved in injuring the employee. This pick list is populated by the
          Object/Substance Module Item within the Administration Module.
        
        The 4 text boxes under the Describe in Detail What Happened section allow you to record information that will flow directly to the OSHA 301 and First Report of injury.
        The Hospital/Treatment Facility pick list is for choosing where the employee went for treatment. This drop down is populated in the Hospitals Module Item within the Incident Reporting Module. The Physician/Health Care Professional pick list is for choosing the person who attended to the employee. This drop down is populated in the Physicians Module Item within the Incident Reporting Module. The system is set up to only populate the Hospital/Treatment Facilities and Physician/Health Care Professionals that are associated with the location associated with that record.
      
    
  
  Recordability Main Tab:
  The recordability main tab allows you the flexibility to easily record both recordable and non-recordable incident information by selecting the appropriate radio button.
  
  In the Non Recordable section, if Frist Aid is selected, a pick list will populate allowing you to select the appropriate form of first aid that was administered. The 14 forms of first aid are provided by OSHA.
   Injury and Illness Incidents Module Item
  Recordability Main Tab
  In the Recordable Incidents section, you can select if this incident is an:
  
    Injury
    Illness
    Privacy case
    Sharp/ Needle stick
    Fatality
    Override OSHA Recordability
    Loss of Consciousness
    If any other treatment other than first aid (that is recordable)
    If you are aware of any issues that make you question if this injury is work related and
    If there was a pre- existing condition.
  
   
  The logic set up in our system is based upon whether you selected this case to be recordable or non- recordable when creating this incident record. If the record was chosen to be set up as an injury in the Incident Type and Location Form and then was changed to a non-recordable in the recordability main tab, the system will stop you and prompt you with a message that states: “By changing this case to Non Recordable, any Days Away or Restricted Duty days away will be lost. Do you wish to continue?”
  Root Cause Main Tab:
  The Root Cause main tab is the first of 2 investigative tabs for this incident. The Root Cause Main tab allows you to declare your problem statement by establishing your 5 Why tree. We have actually taken this out to 10 Why for your investigation. These are all free form text boxes.
  
  What Happened Mini Tab:
  This is a text field used to give a description of the incident in greater detail due to the larger amount of text than allowed in “Give a Brief Description” text box.
  Review Approval Process Mini Tab:
  This is where you can set up a review/ approval process, using a series of email alerts and reminders, for an incident to go through the different levels of review necessary with an automated process. The review process is set up in the Administration Module within the Review Process Module Item.
  Cost/Hours Mini Tab:
  This tab provides the user the ability to view any cost information associated with this incident. The cost information can be pulled back from the TPA and populated here automatically, or can be entered manually based on the users profile level.
  Additionally, the reserve for this incident can be assigned and tracked within this mini tab.
  
  File/Updates Mini Tab:
  This is where supporting documentation regarding this incident can be attached. Attachments can include pictures, videos, scanned documents, pdf’s and more. By selecting the “View Valid File Types” button, you can see all file formats that are supported in this tab. It also records any date/time stamps any updates recorded in this tab.
  
  People Involved Mini Tab:
  This is where information from a witnesses, first responders, or any other person/people that may be associated with the incident can be captured. Record who they are, how to get a hold of them, and their statement.
  Corrective Actions Mini Tab: Anywhere in the system you can assign a corrective action that are enforced through a series of automated emails and alerts. The controls that govern the coming due, escalation and past due emails and alerts are client defined within the Alerts Module and Alerts Module Item. Once you have completed your initial set up, they will fire off automatically as applicable. All corrective actions can be updated directly from an email, you do not have to log into the system to update the statuses.
  
  Communication Mini Tab:
  In addition to automated email alerts you can broadcast an incident report to a group of people via an email, directly from this tab. Select the person or group of people you would like to receive the email and attach files from the “Files” mini tab using point and click check boxes.
  
  To set up the names or groups who can receive these emails are done in the Administration Module within the Communications Module Item. The communications is set up based on location. Once a location is selected the list of recipients can be created by individuals which can then create groups. To upload individuals there is an Upload Wizard button which gives you step by step directions to load more than one person at a time.
  
  History Mini Tab:
  This feature will show you any/all other incidents the employee has been involved in with your organization since the start of their employment. You can view the historical incident details by selecting the incident record in the display grid and select the “View” button.
  
  Edit - To edit an incident record follow the steps below:
  
    
      
        Highlight desired incident record with one click
        Select the Edit button at the top
        Edit the incident record as needed
        Select Save and Close
           
          Delete – To remove an incident record, we usually leave all records for historical purposes even if they are no longer needed at this point in time, follow the steps below:
        
        Highlight desired incident record with one click
        Select the Delete button at the top
        Select the Delete button within the popup
           
          Print – To print an incident record follow the steps below:
        
        Highlight desired incident record with one click
        Select the Print button at the top
        A PDF version of the incident record will be created
        Select print to print the record
           
          View – This will open up the incident record so you can view the details without editing them:
        
        Select desired incident record
        Click the View button
        The record will open allowing you to view the details
           
          Send to Excel – This will take all the incident records shown in the search grid and transport it to an excel sheet. It will only include the details seen in the search grid not the details shown on any other forms. If there is more than one page you will have to send to excel for each page. It only sends the page you are currently on to excel:
        
        Click Send To Excel Button
        The incident records will be transported and open via Excel
           
          Search – is used to find a variable quickly without having to look through all the variables.
        
        Type your search value in any of the blank spaces within the header boxes (ex: ORGANIZATION, LOCATION, CASE NUMBER, CASE STATUS, INCIDENT TYPE, INCIDENT LEVEL, FIRST NAME, LAST NAME, INJURY DATE, SUBMITED TO TPA, DEPARTMENT)
        Click Search
        The list will refresh and display items that match your search characters
        For a wildcard search simply enclose your search value within %’s (ex: %San Diego%) again the list will refresh and display items that match your search characters
      
    
  
   
  Sent Status, Print Short Report, and Print MSHA Form 7000-1
   
  Sent Status:
  Allows Users to view if an incident record has been submitted to their TPA. Highlight the Record and click the Sent Status button. A record can be submitted only once. If the record has not been submitted it can be submitted using the Submit to TPA button.
   
   
  If the record has been submitted to the TPA it will show the date and time it was submitted. If the record needs to be resubmitted for some reason, there is a check box which is profile controlled and allows for a record to be resubmitted. The user can then resubmit the record.
   
  Print Short Report:
  Allows Users to generate a short version of the incident report for any incident record in the MSHA Incident Module Item. Highlight the record desired and click the Print Short Report button. The Report will generate into a PDF.
   
  Print MSHA Form 7000-1:
  Allows Users to generate a MSHA Form 7000-1 for any incident report located within MSHA Incidents Module Item. Highlight the record desired and click the Print MSHA Form 7000-1 button. The Report will generate into a PDF.
   
   
   
  Submit to TPA:
  Allows Users to submit incident records directly to a TPA. Highlight the desired incident record. Click the Submit to TPA button. The claim submission form will populate. If you want to submit the claim click the Submit this Claim button.
   
   
  A confirmation that the claim was submitted will appear. You can print this for your records.
   
   
  Input Quarterly Details
  The MSHA Module Item allows Users to collect Mine data and run MSHA reports based on Location.
   
  Input Quarterly Details:
  Allows Users to input the number of people, employee hours, and production of clean coal based on several categories by location. This can be done Quarterly which is separated by the Main Tabs.
  Print MSHA Form 7000-2:
  Allows Users to generate a MSHA Form 7000-2 report for any of the locations in the MSHA Summary Module Item. Highlight the location desired and click the MSHA Form 7000-2 button. The Select MSHA Summary screen will populate. Select the year, the quarter and if you are going to manually input the number of MSHA Injuries and Illnesses, then click ok. The Report will generate into a PDF.
   
  Send to Excel – This will take all the MSHA incident records shown in the search grid and transport it to an excel sheet. It will only include the details seen in the search grid not the details shown on any other forms. If there is more than one page you will have to send to excel for each page. It only sends the page you are currently on to excel:
  
    Click Send To Excel Button
    The MSHA incident records will be transported and open via Excel
      Search – is used to find a variable quickly without having to look through all the variables.
    
    Type your search value in any of the blank spaces within the header boxes (ex: ORGANIZATION, LOCATION, ADDRESS 1, CITY, COUNTY, COUNTRY, STATE, ZIP, LOCATIO CODE, MSHA ID)
    Click Search
    The list will refresh and display items that match your search characters
    For a wildcard search simply enclose your search value within %’s (ex: %Nashville%) again the list will refresh and display items that match your search characters

Path::contents/AIC Internal Troubleshoot.relPath: contents/assets/css/Benefits of Custom Profile Levels for robohelp.css

Path::contents/AIC Internal Troubleshoot: Benefits of Custom Profile Levels

Benefits of Custom Profile Levels
     
     
    Overview
     
    This document will explain the benefits and importance of setting up custom profile levels for the AIC system. Going forward these can be modified and new profiles added to meet the needs of the Organization.
     
    The 3 most Common Profile Types are:
    
      ADMINISTRATOR
      RECORDKEEPER (aka End User)
      READ ONLY ( aka View Only)
    
     
    By separating out different levels, you are granting access or limiting access based on the selections in the Profile Setup Form. How the leveling system works is that the lower the level #, the higher access ability the user will have. For example, if there are 4 levels set up in the application, the level 4's will have the "lowest" level of access, and will not have the ability to change the security setup for any of the level 3's, 2's, and level 1's access. The level 3's will have access to update the security setup for any of the level 4's because they are at a "lower" level. The level 2's can update the security setup for any of the level 3's & 4's etc.
     
    ADMINISTRATOR – Level 1
     
    This level is used for the head company Administrators who will be the ultimate decision makers for all actions within the application. For example, these users will be Adding/Editing Locations, Modifying the Organization Structure, Adding/Editing Pick Lists, User Setup, and Security Profiles Setup for Users, as well as Alerts setup. Users at this level (Usually only a select few) will have access to everything in the application, as well as access to all locations.
    Administrators have the ability to make updates to any profile with a level that is "higher". EX: Level 2's, Level 3's or higher.
     
    
      ‎RECORDKEEPER – Level 2
     
    This level is used for the users who will be entering in data on a daily basis. For example, these users will be Adding/Editing Incident Records, Entering Employee Hours, Corrective Actions/Activity Calendar, and Basic Reporting including OSHA reports. Recordkeepers usually only have access to 1 Location (Work Location).
    Users in Level 2 have the ability to make updates to any profile with a level that is "higher". EX: Level 3's or higher
     
     
    READ ONLY – Level 3
     
    This level is used for the users who will only be able to View, Print, and/or Pull Reports from the application. These users will be unable to Add, Edit, or Delete any data within the system.
    Users in Level 3 (If there are no other levels "higher") will not have the ability to make any updates to any profile, even their own.

      ‎Welcome
     
    Welcome to Applications International Corporation!
     
    Our Implementation Team at AIC is looking forward to working with you on a very fast, easy, and successful system implementation. Our goal is to get the system ready for roll out in a timely and organized manner.
     
    Your AIC Project Management Team (PLACE CAM AT THE TOP)
    
      Amy Perry – Project Manager
      Ashley Fallin - Project Manager
      Breanne Ederer – Project Manager
      Hannah Bilawa - Project Manager
      Jeannine Comeaux – Project Manager
      Ruth Martinez - Project Manager
    
    
      Victoria Partington - Project Manager
      Zach Houston – Project Manager
      Valerie Cleare – President and C.E.O
    
     
    Please send all emails to aicsupport@appsint.com.
     
    
      ‎The AIC Approach
     
    Our approach is to make your implementation as uneventful as possible.
     
    To do this, we rely on our track record of large scale successful implementations, detailed project documentation and good communication with the client and implementation team.
     
    As part of the implementation we will provide:
    
      Project Documentation for integration points; Employee File, Employee Hours File, etc.
      Excel based templates for defining pick list values, with defaults.
      Excel based templates for the upload of historical data.
      Environment for reviewing loaded data.
        
          As your Organization Structure and Location Data are loaded…review it!
          As your pick list values are pre-populated…review it!!
          As your historical data is loaded…review it!!
          As part of the training process, we will create a copy of this environment for training your users.
        
      
      Web based portal, https://projects.appsint.com for tracking all implementation specific supporting documentation, tracking action items with estimated completion dates (all enforced by automated email alerts and messaging), and status updates on the implementation. All implementation team members, both AIC and client, have access to the site and are encouraged to contribute.
      Weekly “Touch Base” Meetings for discussing action item status, addressing questions from the group and to identify any impediments to the implementation.
        
          “Touch Base” Meetings are held on Tuesdays, Wednesdays or Thursdays. The group will agree upon a time and a meeting notice will be provided.
        
      
    
     
    Many of the action items happen in parallel. AIC has developed several tools that allow for the quick upload of project management data. For this reason it is important that data be provided in the exact format requested for quicker turnaround times.
     
    Next Stop…the GET ROLLING Meeting!!!
    
      ‎Implementation Tools - AIC Project Site
     
    As part of the implementation process, we also provide a web based tool for tracking all projects - supporting documentation as well as action items. Both the (Client Name) Implementation Team and the AIC Support Team will use the projects site to share necessary documents. All (Client Name) Implementation Team members will have access to the projects site.

    Employee File (Demographic) Feed
     
    The AIC Enterprise Compliance Management System is an open platform and provides the ability to “load” employee demographic information from an HRIS or Employee Demographic System on an ongoing basis. With this in place, data entry is streamlined as there is no need to manually enter employees into the application.
     
    The document that explains the secure process for bringing over employee data on a periodic basis can be found at https://projects.appsint.com, Corporate Document Library. This document includes details on:
    
      File Format (Fixed Width or CSV)
      File Naming
      Record Inclusion
      File Encryption (Required)
      Transmission Frequency
      FTP/SFTP Information
      Online Training – E Learner Usernames Generation
         
        Note: Employees can be manually added to the application through the interface provided.
         
        Data Integrity
         
        To protect the integrity and accuracy of your data, it is AIC Policy that we do not manipulate your files in any way. This includes: modifying headers, adjusting data fields, associating locations, adding leading zeros, etc. If a file is provided with incorrect or incomplete data, we will return the file and request for a revised file that meets all requirements.
         
        People Role Assignments
         
        Role assignments are available for employees as part of the upload process. These can be assigned individually or by groups/profile levels. Each user can have as many or as few roles as needed.
         
        Assignments can be made at the time of adding employees or after exploration of the application.
         
        By selecting a specific role that employee will automatically populate into any drop downs or pick lists that requires a responsible person for that location.
        
          ‎Employee Hours Feed
         
        The AIC Enterprise Compliance Management System is an open platform and provides the ability to “load” employee hours worked demographic information from an HRIS or Payroll System on an ongoing basis. With this in place, data entry is streamlined as there is no need to manually enter this data into the application. This is information is used for Federal Compliance Reports, Frequency/Severity Rate Calculations and data normalization.
         
        The document that explains the secure process for bringing over employee hours worked data on a periodic basis can be found at https://projects.appsint.com, Corporate Document Library. This document includes details on:
      
      File Format (Fixed Width or CSV)
      File Naming
      Record Inclusion
      File Encryption (Required)
      Transmission Frequency
      FTP/SFTP Information
    
     
    There are four options for the upload of Employee Hours worked data based on the needs of the Organization:
    
      Employee Hours Worked by Location by Month (most commonly used)
      Employee Hours Worked by Location – Department by Month
      Employee Hours Worked by Location by Day
        
          Recommended if looking to report by Fiscal Year.
        
      
      Employee Hours Worked by Employee
    
     
    Note: Employee Hours can be manually added to the application if needed.
     
    Data Integrity
     
    To protect the integrity and accuracy of your data, it is AIC Policy that we do not manipulate your files in any way. This includes: modifying headers, adjusting data fields, associating locations, adding leading zeros, etc. If a file is provided with incorrect or incomplete data, we will return the file and request for a revised file that meets all requirements.
     
     
    
      ‎ 
    Automated Feeds
    Acknowledgements - Exceptions
     
    As part of the automated employee and employee hours file transmission process we send automated e-mails to inform team members of the upload status.
     
    We break exception into three types which are communicated via email to your designated team members.
     
    Emails consist of a summary PDF and detail excel file:
    
      Type 1 – No File Received as Scheduled
      Type 2 – File Received but were unable to process. In this case, a detailed reason is provided.
      Type 3 – File was processed successfully. Email provides:
        
          Number of records in File
          Number of records Added
          Number of records Updated
          Number of records that were not processed
          Any exceptions
        
      
    
     
    Moving forward you will receive these emails directly from alerts@appsint.com.
     
    As part of the implementation process we will identify the recipients and the types of exceptions they should receive via email.
    
      ‎ 
    Incident Management Solution - Pick List Validation Tables
     
    Within the application we standardize and streamline data entry through pick lists (pre-defined values) instead of having the end user type in the values. This also ensures consistent data for accurate reporting. For many of the items you’ll find that there are default values for you to review, modify and send back for upload. The maintenance of these values going forward can be done within the application through the point and click user interface. There are several items that we strongly suggest be identified up front. The remaining items can be defined as users add records to the application.
     
    AIC provides default or example values for the majority of the picklists in the application.  A template for defining and uploading picklists can be found on the projects website at https://projects.appsint.com, Corporate Document Library.
     
    
    
      ‎ 
    Case Numbering
     
    Within the application, each Incident that is entered is assigned a case number to use as an identifier. Below are the available options for Case Numbering.
     
    User Generated: This will be a free form text box for the User to manually enter any case number of your choice.
     
    Auto Generated: A Case Number will be automatically assigned to each Incident by the system.
    
      If choosing to use the system-generated case numbering, these can be generated as a sequence per Location, or on a global scale.
         
        
          By Location – Each Location will have their own sequence. Example:
            
              San Diego Location: 2016-001, 2016-002, 2016-003
              New York Location: 2016-001, 2016-002, 2016-003
              Available Formats: (YYYY=Year, L=Location Code, M=Month, ###=Consecutive numbering)
                
                  YYYY-L-###
                  YYYY-L-####
                  MLYY###
                  YYYY-###
                     
                  
                
              
            
          
          Global: The case numbers will be unique, regardless of which location the incident was created for. Example:
        
      
    
    
      San Diego Location: 2016-001, 2016-002, 2016-003
      New York Location: 2016-004, 2016-005, 2016-006
    
     
    Please select which format of Case Numbering works best for your Organization prior to entering incidents into the application.

These can be added in the form of a Picklist, single line free-form text, multi-line text box, point and click date and time drop-downs, and check boxes.

      ‎ 
    TPA – Claim Submission
     
    The AIC Enterprise Compliance Management System provides the ability to submit Claims electronically to a Third Party Administrator. We have the ability to integrate with any TPA for Workers Compensation Claims, Vehicle Liability Claims, and General Liability Claims. This replaces:
    
      Phoning
      Faxing
      Emailing
    
    …and promotes data consistency by eliminating duplicate data entry.
     
    **IMPORTANT DISCLAIMER - AIC will NOT add client defined / custom fields to any existing Third Party Administrator (TPA) Claim Submission Electronic Data Integration (EDI). AIC has stringent security requirements as part of our System and Organization Controls (SOC) Report under the SSAE-18 standard audits, which limit AIC in sending anything outside the scope of the current integration. AIC will not do anything that may affect data integrity for our clients.
    **IMPORTANT NOTE - AIC is the first notification to the TPA, not the State. AIC will send the TPA the basic required information in order to file the First Report of Injury (FROI) with the insurance company/TPA. These are regulatory reports and AIC does not want to require anything beyond the basic requirements; based on our experience requiring additional fields may lead users to enter false information in order to get the claim submitted. Many times additional fields (beyond the basic requirements) are not available when the initial claim is entered and submitted to the TPA.
     
    To submit Workers Compensation claims from the application, we will need to work with your TPA to setup the process.
     
    Please send an email to the TPA contact person we will need to work with, introducing AIC so they can be prepared and receptive for us to contact them.

      Quarterly
      Yearly
    
     
    In addition, reminder alerts can be setup and sent to vested parties for the locations they have access to when data is not entered by a certain day of the month.
     
    From a tracking standpoint, there are two options:
    
      Report Builder – Case List Report – Which will allow a user to build a report extracting the raw data entered into the application each month and schedule it for automated delivery.
        
          This report can be exported as a PDF, Excel, CSV or RTF.
             
          
        
      
      Dashboard – Setup the leading indicator scorecards on the dashboard to track the number of locations that have met their goals for a given time frame.
    
    
      ‎ 
    Regulatory Compliance Module
     
    The Regulatory Compliance Module allows you to define and manage all of your organization specific requirements for each location, for example permits, certifications, audits, leases, and more.  The Compliance Solution integrates into AIC's One Global Platform® which will enforce your business processes through automated email notifications and messages, reminders, escalations alerts, as well as provide real-time access to your data through robust reporting and dashboards with drill-down.
     
    Client Defined Requirements
     
    The new Compliance Module will be used for maintaining the location based compliance and reporting items with the following six objectives in mind:
     
    
      Define – Corporation defines which Compliance and Reporting Requirements are relevant to their company.
      Assign – Assign Compliance and Report Requirements based on Location.
      Track - Upload supporting documentation and utilize the One Global Platform® for maintaining Corporate Compliance.
      Remind - Client defined automated email alerts and messages based upon time, event, or threshold.
      Report - Use the AIC Report Builder to build and schedule reports for automated delivery to show status of upcoming/past due requirements. 
      Dashboards – Through the use of the dashboard you will be able to see all requirements per location complete with drill down into the details of the requirement.
    
    
      ‎ 
    Going Live
    Exciting times!!!
     
    Your site has been created and…
    
      The Organization/Location Structure has been uploaded.
      All excel templates provided during the process have been completed, provided to AIC and uploaded successfully to the application.
      All integration points (data points) are complete operational.
        
          Employee File Successfully Uploaded
          Employee Hours File Successfully Uploaded
          Claim Submission Integration complete
        
      
    
     
    Once all of these items are in place and the data has been uploaded successfully to the application….we will have you up and running within thirty days from that point.
    Important Note: We do not schedule Go Live Dates on Fridays, Saturdays, Sundays, or Mondays.
     
    Time estimates are contingent on receiving complete data.
     
     
     
    Ongoing Administrative Responsibility
     
    After the initial implementation of the system the time needed for ongoing maintenance of the application is minimal. Users who have administrator level access have the ability to maintain the following core data within the application.
     
    Organization Structure
     
    As your Org Structure changes, you can use the drag and drop functionality within the application to easily make updates or add additional levels.
    
      The Org Structure controls how the data rolls up for reporting purposes.
      If you move a location within the Org Structure, the data automatically moves with it since data is tied to locations.
    
     
    Locations
     
    Update the application to add any new locations, make them in-active, or closed.
    
      Usually a location will be a physical location.
      Incidents and employees are tied to locations.
      Administrators have the ability to control mapping codes to locations.
    
     
    Users / User Profiles
     
    Setup usernames/passwords for users to login to the application.
    
      Select the locations the users will have access to.
      User access to application functionality is determined by the user “Profile” they are assigned to.
      User Profiles can be modified by administrators.
    
     
    Tools
     
    Once you’ve gone live with the application there are a series of tools available for measuring system usage:
    
      Login History for tracking login attempts; successful and unsuccessful.
      Last Login Date per User
      Automated Email Alerts
      Using the Automated Reports for verifying the type and quality if the data being entered.
    
    As part of the implementation process your Implementation Lead will walk through these tools and make some recommendations on how you may want to use them based on your business processes.
     
    Change Request Sign Off 
     
    Although AIC is able to customize various areas of the system during the implementation process; for any change that will require AIC development work the AIC Discovery Process will be required. This is the full process we adhere to for all changes/enhancements. Depending on the size and scope of the change, this process may take anywhere from a few minutes for a simple label change to several months for a new module. The final product will be a document that will detail development work and associated time and cost. The investment in these services is typically $200.00 per hour (may change at AIC upper management discretion), billed as actual. If you want to proceed with development, we will credit the discovery process fee to your project.
